item.title: Play with Poincaré series and SymPy
item.description: This post is an article for December 11, 2019 of [2019 Numerical Calculation Advent Calendar](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/numerical_analysis), but it is almost poem... Poincaré series (loosely defined) $$ V = \bigoplus_{k = 0}^\infty V_k $$ Let be the vector space with degree ($\deg V_k = k$). Then, **Poincare series **$P(V; t)$ of $V$ is transformed into the following formal power series $$ P(V; t) := \sum_{k = 0}^\infty (\dim V_k)\ t^k $$ It is defined by.
